cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 9th September, 1918.
1. Western Front.
British.
The Third Army attacked this morning N. of HEUDECOUR? and advanced to a line N.E. of REVELON - 1,000 yards west of GOUZEACOURT - and 500 yards east of GOUZEACOURT WOOD. The enemy have heavily counter-attacked the result of which is not yet known.
There is no change on the rest of the front.
2. French & Italian Fronts.
There is no change.
3. Macedonian Front.
In the STRUMA valley the 1st Greek Corps has advanced its outpost line, without opposition from the enemy, to the general line KAKARASKA - KALENDRA - HAZNATAR.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
9th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.45 p.m.
